results.firPara: For a man who values his accumulation of data so highly, there is one statistic that will stalk Sam Allardyce for as long as he holds on to his precious new role. As he contemplates its significance, it will give him an insight into the challenges that confronted his predecessor. He has his dream job at long last but this number is the stuff of nightmares for any England manager.
results.secPara: There can be no excuses for the way that Roy Hodgson bungled Englands chances of succeeding at Euro 2016 in isolation. In a wider context, though, Hodgsons underachievement cannot change the fact that he was selecting a squad from a dwindling pool of homegrown talent, with the number of English players starting in the Premier League dropping to 31% last season. That is an average of just over 68 players a week and at this point Allardyce could be forgiven for wondering if this job is all it is cracked up to be.
results.webTitle: Sam Allardyce braced for England life with shallow pool of homegrown talent

results.firPara: Thats all for now! Thanks as always for following with us and be sure to check the match report below.
results.secPara: And theres the whistle. The scoreline will make it look closer than it was, considering Real Madrid more or less sent on their youth team when the score was 3-nil. But its nice consolation nonetheless for Chelsea, who today played before a bigger crowd than ever before in their 102-year history.
results.webTitle: Real Madrid 3-2 Chelsea: International Champions Cup – as it happened

results.firPara: Celtic were outclassed in their pre-season friendly against Barcelona, with goals from Arda Turan, Munir and an Efe Ambrose own goal giving the Catalans a 3-1 win.
results.secPara: Well that was half a football game, half a bunch of people running around slightly pointlessly. But thats pre-season friendlies for you, and nobody expected to learn a damn thing. Still, even at about quarter pace, this Barca lot are bloody good.
results.webTitle: Barcelona 3-1 Celtic: International Champions Cup – as it happened

results.firPara: • Striker says Paul Pogbas arrival would make things even more interesting
results.secPara: • Striker says Paul Pogbas arrival would make things even more interesting
results.webTitle: Zlatan Ibrahimovic sees ‘something big’ happening at Manchester United

results.firPara: The new manager at Elland Road is unconcerned by the short self-life of his predecessors under the owner, Massimo Cellino
results.secPara: Not long ago Garry Monk was being touted as a possible England manager. It is strange how much can change in a year, a peripatetic period for Monk bookended by Swansea Citys highest league finish and his appointment as the seventh head coach of Leeds United since the spring of 2014.
results.webTitle: Leeds manager Garry Monk: if you worry about the sack you’ll never take any job

results.firPara: • Steven Pressley resigned as Fleetwood manager on Tuesday
results.secPara: Fleetwood Town have appointed Uwe Rösler as the clubs head coach, following the resignation of Steven Pressley on Tuesday.
results.webTitle: Fleetwood Town appoint former Leeds manager Uwe Rösler as head coach

results.firPara: From Rafa Benítez and buoyant Burton to stingy Stubbs and Tony Xias healthy Villa, what to look out for in the English Football League for 2016-17
results.secPara: From Rafa Benítez and buoyant Burton to stingy Stubbs and Tony Xias healthy Villa, what to look out for in the English Football League for 2016-17
results.webTitle: Football League 2016-17 season: 16 things to watch out for

results.firPara: The city of Culiacán in north-west Mexico, best known as the bastion of the notorious Sinaloa cartel fronted by the billionaire drug kingpin Joaquín El Chapo Guzmán, was an unlikely place for Manchester Citys new manager, Pep Guardiola, to begin the process that would culminate in him becoming the worlds most sought-after coach.
results.secPara: Baseball, not football, has long been the most popular sport here and the newly founded local side Dorados de Sinaloa were minnows locked in a desperate relegation struggle when Guardiola, who turned 35 that month, arrived in January 2006.
results.webTitle: How a six-month spell in Mexico set Pep Guardiola on road to coaching greatness | Duncan Tucker

results.firPara: • Jackett was sacked by Championship club on Friday night
results.secPara: Wolverhampton Wanderers have hired Walter Zenga as their head coach, after the club sacked Kenny Jackett late on Friday night.
results.webTitle: Wolves appoint Walter Zenga as head coach after ditching Kenny Jackett

results.firPara: Wolves have terminated the contract of their manager, Kenny Jackett, with immediate effect, bringing to an end his three-year spell in charge a week before the new Championship season starts.
results.secPara: A statement released at 11pm on Friday night said that the new main Wolves director, Jeff Shi, had made the decision to relieve Jackett of his duties following discussions over the past few days.
